snippet: Commissioner David Stern fined the Spurs $250,000 for sending home four of their starters before a game in Miami, raising a significant question for bosses everywhere: when is it unreasonable to give someone the day off?
abstract: Basketball Commissioner David Stern fines San Antonio Spurs $250,000 after coach Gregg Popovich allowed four of the team's key players to take a day off rather than play away game against Miami Heat; incident may set new precedent and raises questions about the ethics of giving strategic time off.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner David Stern fined the Spurs $250,000 for sending home four of their starters before a game in Miami, raising a significant question for bosses everywhere: when is it unreasonable to give someone the day off?

headline.seo: David Stern Fines Spurs for Day Off, Raising Question for All Bosses
headline.main: Basketball Players’ Night Off Makes a Stand for Sitting Out
